text: Would having more granular permissions on the tables help?

I think having something in the HubDB area like forms would help. For example, our client has interns and other people that they would want the data entered in by, so simply showing them the table and having them enter data could be overwhelming for them

or even so, the person in charge of the site is not a technical person at all, so we can show/train them on how to enter the data, but when they have a DB that has 30+ columns and over 100+ rows, it can get confusing for them on where they are at or what they need to enter as the HubDB Column headers aren't sticky
Are they editing existing data, or just inputting new entries?
<@U2H3TT8F2> arent you able to change the domain on a post level?
pages yes, but blog posts you cannot
